intro: Trianthema decandrum var. flavum, commonly known as the yellow marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
